comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.telsu.fi/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.telsu.fi%2F) ### Comment Username: @peace2000 > There's a big blank ad container at the top. To reproduce the current situation, enable the Finnish list. > > If I hide that element via: > > telsu.fi##.pb_t > > The site detects that ads are blocked, thus showing a nag about blocked ads. I can't figure out a working way for this. Restyling the container doesn't work either, the site seems to have checks for the style properties of the element. > > Note: the detection happens, when I try to view tv program information by clicking any tv program. comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end. Perhaps some of the rules can't be executed in time.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/157481#issuecomment-1652378890
> Needing to watch an ad to play music on Pandora. Ads are still blocked even when disabled and allowed.

I have added rules which should fix it, filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.

<hr>

Regarding issue with log in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/157481#issue-1822933575
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.

>Additional testing finds that simply disabling the Adguard browser extension does not help. I have to use the Adguard Windows application and select 'disable' there.

Do I understand correctly that you use AdGuard AdBlocker extension and AdGuard for Windows application?
If so, what filter lists do you have enabled in AdGuard app and do you have `Stealth` mode enabled?

It seems to work as intended. > Reference: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/154877 > > hotmediahub.com#%#(async()=>{if(location.href.includes("?slid="))try{const t=new URLSearchParams(location.search).get("slid");if(!t||!t.length)return;const a=await fetch(`https://hotmediahub.com/shorturl/getoriginurl?&surl_key=${t}`),i=await a.json();if(i?.data?.origin_url&&i.data.origin_url.startsWith("http"))location.assign(i.data.origin_url)}catch(t){console.debug(t)}})(); ### Screenshots
